com.frostphyr.avail.math

Class MatrixUtils

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.frostphyr.avail.math.MatrixUtils

  • public class MatrixUtils
extends Object
    Utility class containing methods to assist with using matrices that are represented as arrays.
    Since:
    1.0

    • Constructor Summary

      MatrixUtils()

      • validateMatrix

        public static boolean validateMatrix(byte[] matrix)
        Returns whether the specified matrix is valid. A matrix is valid if it meets the following criteria:
        • It is not null
        • It is not empty (length is greater than 0)
        Parameters:
        matrix - the matrix to validate
        Returns:
        true if the matrix is valid; false otherwise

      • validateMatrix

        public static boolean validateMatrix(byte[][] matrix)
        Returns whether the specified matrix is valid. A matrix is valid if it meets the following criteria:
        • The matrix or any row (array) is not null
        • The matrix or any row (array) is not empty (length is greater than 0)
        • Every row (array) is the same length
        Parameters:
        matrix - the matrix to validate
        Returns:
        if the matrix is valid; false otherwise

      • validateMatrix

        public static boolean validateMatrix(short[][] matrix)
        Returns whether the specified matrix is valid. A matrix is valid if it meets the following criteria:
        • The matrix or any row (array) is not null
        • The matrix or any row (array) is not empty (length is greater than 0)
        • Every row (array) is the same length
        Parameters:
        matrix - the matrix to validate
        Returns:
        if the matrix is valid; false otherwise

      • validateMatrix

        Returns whether the specified matrix is valid. A matrix is valid if it meets the following criteria:
        • The matrix or any row (array) is not null
        • The matrix or any row (array) is not empty (length is greater than 0)
        • Every row (array) is the same length
        Parameters:

        Returns:
        if the matrix is valid; false otherwise

      • add

        public static byte[] add(byte[] matrix1,
         byte[] matrix2)
        Adds the two specified matrices and returns the result. Both matrices must be the same size.
        Parameters:
        matrix1 - the first matrix to add; must be a valid matrix
        matrix2 - the second matrix to add; must be a valid matrix
        Returns:
        the sum of both specified matrices
        See Also:
        validateMatrix(byte[])

      • multiply

        public static byte[] multiply(byte[] matrix1,
              byte[][] matrix2)
        Multiplies the two specified matrices and returns the result. The number of columns of the first matrix must equal the number of rows of the second matrix.
        Parameters:
        matrix1 - the first matrix to multiply; must be a valid matrix
        matrix2 - the second matrix to multiply; must be a valid matrix
        Returns:
        the product of both specified matrices
        See Also:
        validateMatrix(byte[]), validateMatrix(byte[][])

      • multiply

        public static short[] multiply(short[] matrix1,
               short[][] matrix2)
        Multiplies the two specified matrices and returns the result. The number of columns of the first matrix must equal the number of rows of the second matrix.
        Parameters:
        matrix1 - the first matrix to multiply; must be a valid matrix
        matrix2 - the second matrix to multiply; must be a valid matrix
        Returns:
        the product of both specified matrices
        See Also:
        validateMatrix(short[]), validateMatrix(short[][])

      • multiply

        public static int[] multiply(int[] matrix1,
             int[][] matrix2)
        Multiplies the two specified matrices and returns the result. The number of columns of the first matrix must equal the number of rows of the second matrix.
        Parameters:
        matrix1 - the first matrix to multiply; must be a valid matrix
        matrix2 - the second matrix to multiply; must be a valid matrix
        Returns:
        the product of both specified matrices
        See Also:
        validateMatrix(short[]), validateMatrix(short[][])

      • multiply

        public static long[] multiply(long[] matrix1,
              long[][] matrix2)
        Multiplies the two specified matrices and returns the result. The number of columns of the first matrix must equal the number of rows of the second matrix.
        Parameters:
        matrix1 - the first matrix to multiply; must be a valid matrix
        matrix2 - the second matrix to multiply; must be a valid matrix
        Returns:
